title: ING, Credit Agricole Issue U.S. Dollar AT1 Bonds
content:
European banks ING and Credit Agricole marketed new Additional Tier 1, or AT1, bonds on Tuesday, LSEG data show.

ING issued a 7.2-year U.S. dollar AT1 bond with an initial price talk in the 7.375% area.

Fair value on this bond looks close to around 6.5%, CreditSights analysts said in a note.

Credit Agricole issued a 10-year U.S. dollar AT 1 bond. The initial price talk was in the 7.625% area, revised to around 7.5%.

"We see fair value for [Tuesday's] deal at just inside 7%," CreditSights said.

AT1 bonds are a risky form of debt issued by banks to meet regulatory capital requirements.
summary: European banks ING and Credit Agricole have issued new Additional Tier 1 (AT1) bonds, with initial price talks in the 7.375% area and around 6.5% for each bond. The AT1 bonds are a risky form of debt issued by banks to meet regulatory capital requirements.
shortSummary: European banks ING and Credit Agricole issued new $10,000 bond offerings for US dollar AT1s, offering up to 7.5% apiece, with potential for sale.
